objects.name: HTTP Flood
objects.description: An adversary may execute a flooding attack using the HTTP protocol with the intent to deny legitimate users access to a service by consuming resources at the application layer such as web services and their infrastructure. These attacks use legitimate session-based HTTP GET requests designed to consume large amounts of a server's resources. Since these are legitimate sessions this attack is very difficult to detect.

external_references.description: Endpoint Denial of Service:Service Exhaustion Flood
Network Denial of Service:Direct Network Flood

x_capec_prerequisites: This type of an attack requires the ability to generate a large amount of HTTP traffic to send to a target server.
